comment: Worst professor I've ever had. Quizzes are 1 question from the hw that he doesn't go over. Lectures cover an insane amount of content with few example problems worked, despite those problems being worth majority of points on tests. Doesn't put any grades in all semester. Only reason I got a B was bc of the curve he does, I didn't learn a thing.
This was the worst professor i've ever taken in the history of my college car
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Gupta is okay, he is very difficult when it comes to the grading of exams, wish he gave extra credit. Attendance is a must, but lectures are very hard to follow and often times leave one more confused. Although, he is willing to answer questions, albeit in a rather overcomplicated manner, as for emails he takes quite some time to reply.

You have to teach yourself everything, and attendance is mandatory. He doesn't respond to emails. There's a report that's 10% of your grade. 3 Exams including the cumulative final. Accent is thick and explanations are hard to follow even if the accent wasn't thick.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Mahesh gupta was by far the worst professor at kennesaw state. He spends his entire time reading powerpoints he stole from online and when explaining math will teach it wrong just to say oops nevermind don't do that on the exam or you will be marked wrong. Exams are extremely hard and he gives a paper. I don't even know how I passed. Don't take him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: extremely tough grader. questions over a million slides in his two exams, and homework is really just quizzes over one of the questions he gives you. attendance affects your grade, and he doesn't put any grades into d2l so you don't know how you're doing until your final grade. no matter how much effort you put into it, it ends horribly

Honestly just don't take him and if you do, be ready to be disappointed no matter how hard you work. He makes such an easy class so difficult by reading hundreds of complicated lecture slides during class and testing over the most vague material. A bad professor is an understatement.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He isn't a bad dude and he does genuinely care about the class but there is so much material and none of it is interesting. It can be hard to understand him some times and difficult to pay attention during class. HW is optional (theres a lot of it) but quizzes are based off of a random question. Tests are absurdly difficult and he doesn't use D2L.

As long as you pay attention in the lectures and take advantage of the suggested practice problems before tests this class is great. I found Professor Gupta to be very willing to talk about the material and give plenty of explanation for complicated topics.

Always say "you guys don't pay attention" and he doesn't believe in his students. Doesn't matter our effort. He probably gives a big curve at the end because no one can pass his class since he tests us on something he doesn't teach. He doesn't do examples at all, but each one of his math problems on the exams are worth about 20-30 points.

I started this class with a lush head of hair but I am now bald from the stress I endured in his class. All the other reviews couldn't be more correct. He goes over conceptual ideas but no actual problems. Can you guess what your quizzes and tests are on? Actual problems. Also, his tests are different from the quizzes. Try to avoid if you can.

I took this class on a chance despite the reviews but I thought that Dr. Gupta was a great professor. The lectures were very clear and there was more than enough time to ask questions. He speaks good english. Tests and quizzes were weighted 90%. There was no homework grade. I do think that the tests were very hard but so is the subject matter.

Terrible teacher who doesnt seem to care at all. Since corona everything is hybrid and he essential tells you not to come, then post lecture recording that are unreadable and monotone. Doesnt seem to do any partial credit on tests which he says are very similar to the homework and quizes, however they arent anywhere close. avoid at all costs.

He's a nice guy, but man is he HARD. Everything that everyone has said is true. He does curve the final grade at the end. Tests are extremely hard, especially without notes. If you end up with this professor, do the homework early and review the answers with him during office hours and he'll help you out. And take good notes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: DO NOT TAKE. Skip the semester if you cant take Nasseri. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES should you take this colossal failure of a teacher. he doesnt explain thing. he curves at the end of the year and doesnt include the students who droped cause they were failing. Im an A student expecting a D or F. Good luck trying to appeal, He doesnt care. DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Honestly one of my least professors I have ever had. Tests are ridiculously difficult and I felt as if I learned NOTHING from Materials Science. If you care about your GPA stay away from this professor. Only redeeming qualities include his big curve at the end (Which let me get an A) and the fact that he is nice. Never taking him again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If you are actually looking to learn something from this course, you will have to do it all on your own with this professor. He gives two test, a final, and a final project. The test averages are around 50-60. He doesn't post any grades so you never know how you are really doing in the class. Come final time get ready to stress TF out.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: His tests don't feel like anything we have even gone over before because he doesn't do any expamples in class. your whole grade weighs on these tests. Probably the most boring lecturer ive ever taken. We've come to find out he doesn't even grade his own tests. He gives an assistant a rubric and the assistant grades the tests.
The content of the examination paper is quite different from what he taught.

I AGREE WITH THE LAST REVIEWER. NICE GUY, YOU CAN UNDERSTAND HIM, AND THE QUIZZES ARE DIRECTLY FROM THE HOMEWORKS. BUT THE TESTS ARE A WHOLE NEW ANIMAL. DOES NOT DO EXAMPLES IN CLASS HARDLY EVER, MOSTLY CONCEPTUAL. BUT THE TESTS HAVE MORE PROBLEMS THAN CONCEPTS-STUDY THE POWERPOINTS HE UPLOADS. ALLOWS FORMULA SHEET ON FINAL ONLY.

He's fine and easy to understand for lecture and the quizzes come directly from the homework. Tests are very different however and he will tell you to study certain material, specifically the homework, but the test questions are nothing like what he teaches or like what is found on homework problems.
